Description: (Repeatable for credit)Directed independent study for freshmen in any department.

(Repeatable for credit)Required of all honors freshmen in lieu of College Writing. Stresses exploration, discussion
and communication of ideas expressed in works related to theme of colloquium.

Prerequisites: admitted to the Honors College and special approval.
Description:
(Repeatable for credit)Focuses on Western and non-Western cultures from a comparative perspective, in order
to identify both different and shared values and to see how one's own culture shapes one's perspective,
ideology, and values.
(Repeatable for credit)Directed independent study for sophomores in any department.

(Repeatable for credit)One-semester course or two-semester sequence exploring interdisciplinary ideas and
issues related to a single theme, by means of readings, discussion and individual papers and projects.
(Repeatable for credit)Directed independent study for juniors in any department.

(Repeatable for credit)One-semester course or two-semester sequence for juniors or seniors exploring
interdisciplinary ideas and issues related to single theme, by means of readings, discussion and individual papers
and projects.

Construction of a senior portfolio, consisting of a collection of artifacts and a reflective essay interpreting the
student's growth during the college years.

Prerequisites: Prior specialapproval of instructor and special approval of and preregistration with Honors College.
Description: (Repeatable for credit)Directed independent study for seniors in any department.
(Repeatable for credit) Thesis or creative project.

(Repeatable for credit)One-semester course or two-semester sequence exploring interdisciplinary ideas and
issues related to single theme, by means of readings, discussion and individual papers and projects.
